Sentencas: Microtubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (mSOFCs) are one of the most promising and efficient devices that convert chemical energy of fuels into electrical energy.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of thermal stresses in a new design of microtubular stack

Sentencas: However, mSOFC stacks work at high operating temperature over 650 degrees C, which leads to thermally induced mechanical stresses and in consequence may cause failure of stack components.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of thermal stresses in a new design of microtubular stack

Sentencas: In order to reduce the local thermal gradients and prevent high stresses in the stack components, it is desirable to study the effect of stack design on its performance.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of thermal stresses in a new design of microtubular stack

Sentencas: For this purpose a 3D numerical approach was developed to estimate thermal expansion of fuel cell inside an mSOFC stack and to reduce the associated experimental efforts and costs.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of thermal stresses in a new design of microtubular stack

Sentencas: Initially, a Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) model was used to calculate the temperature and species concentration profiles.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of thermal stresses in a new design of microtubular stack

Sentencas: During the second modeling step temperature profiles were used in the thermo-mechanical model to calculate the thermal stress distribution in the mSOFC stack.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of thermal stresses in a new design of microtubular stack

Sentencas: The results maximum thermal axial elongation that equals 1.4 mm for the mSOFC stack.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of thermal stresses in a new design of microtubular stack

Sentencas: The modelled maximum radial elongation was equal to 0.5 mm in the contact areas of the cylindrical housing and manifolds on the fuel inlet side.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of thermal stresses in a new design of microtubular stack
